page.title: 18Religion in Chelmsley Wood
page.content: There are seven churches in the area all of them without a spire or a tower. The churches are small and the ones in the Chelmsley Wood estate are less than twenty years old. 70% of the people questioned admit that they have no religous beliefs but many of them do go to church for weddings and funerals. Only 5% go to a place of worship more than fifteen times in a year and 10% never go. The list below shows the different religions in the area: Church of England 20% Catholic 5% Jehovah's Witnesses 2% Christodelphian 2% Muslim 1% The people who practice their religion most actively are the Jehovah's Witnesses.
